attributes.comment:
I really mean ?To whom it may concern?

The proposed fee increase is outrageous to say the least. The range of increase
between minimum of 100% to more than 300% is mind blowing. As far as I know
most immigrant families currently pay a high price to an already costly system
which not only includes the pricy lawyers but also the high fees.

Just to review the things in some prospectus lets assume the other general prices
which the American Citizens pays, say the gas price becomes only twice to
$5.50/gallon from current $2.75/gallon, the milk price becomes $9.00 from $4.50,
the one bedroom apartment rent becomes $2550 from $1275, it surely appears to
be a doomsday.

How possibly an agency can assume these increases to be fair or just. My focus
is only to N400 which is the application of Citizenship. For me and my wife
application cost alone will be approx $1400 including the biometric identification. I
recently told my wife about this fee hike, her initial reaction was disbelief followed
by laughter and than a plan to start saving at least $100 for next two years before
we ever file application for citizenship. Please note that we already put a lot of
money towards immigration matters before coming to this point of citizenship. We
also have two small kids and there needs cannot be cut.

Honestly I have never heard of such a drastic increase in fee for any matter. Even
in the country where I used to live and prices can go up and down as a usual
practice but never even close to this fee hike proposal.

I really urge the congress to look deep into matter and do the justice that?s what
the only thing the citizens of democracy desires.
Thanks

SMO
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
